pokemon.description: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.

pokemon.name: Brute-bonnet
pokemon.description: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Flutter-mane
pokemon.description: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.

pokemon.name: Slither-wing
pokemon.description: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

pokemon.name: Sandy-shocks
pokemon.description: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.

pokemon.name: Iron-treads
pokemon.description: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.

pokemon.name: Iron-bundle
pokemon.description: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.

pokemon.name: Iron-hands
pokemon.description: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.

pokemon.name: Iron-jugulis
pokemon.description: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.

pokemon.name: Iron-moth
pokemon.description: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.

pokemon.name: Iron-thorns
pokemon.description: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.

pokemon.name: Frigibax
pokemon.description: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

pokemon.name: Arctibax
pokemon.description: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

pokemon.name: Baxcalibur
pokemon.description: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

pokemon.name: Gimmighoul
pokemon.description: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

pokemon.name: Gholdengo
pokemon.description: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.

pokemon.name: Wo-chien
pokemon.description: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Chien-pao
pokemon.description: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.

pokemon.name: Ting-lu
pokemon.description: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Chi-yu
pokemon.description: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

pokemon.name: Roaring-moon
pokemon.description: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.

pokemon.name: Iron-valiant
pokemon.description: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.

pokemon.name: Koraidon
pokemon.description: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

pokemon.name: Miraidon
pokemon.description: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.

pokemon.name: Walking-wake
pokemon.description: This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.

pokemon.name: Iron-leaves
pokemon.description: Many of its physical characteristics match those of a Virizion from the future that was covered in a paranormal magazine.

pokemon.name: Dipplin
pokemon.description: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.

pokemon.name: Poltchageist
pokemon.description: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Sinistcha
pokemon.description: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.

pokemon.name: Okidogi
pokemon.description: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.

pokemon.name: Munkidori
pokemon.description: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.

pokemon.name: Fezandipiti
pokemon.description: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.

pokemon.name: Ogerpon
pokemon.description: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.

pokemon.name: Archaludon
pokemon.description: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.

pokemon.name: Hydrapple
pokemon.description: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.

pokemon.name: Gouging-fire
pokemon.description: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.

pokemon.name: Raging-bolt
pokemon.description: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.

pokemon.name: Iron-boulder
pokemon.description: It resembles a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.

pokemon.name: Iron-crown
pokemon.description: It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.

pokemon.name: Terapagos
pokemon.description: Terapagos protects itself using its power to transform energy into hard crystals. This Pokémon is the source of the Terastal phenomenon.

pokemon.name: Pecharunt
pokemon.description: It feeds others toxic mochi that draw out desires and capabilities. Those who eat the mochi fall under Pecharunt’s control, chained to its will.
